title: Japan’s SLIM successfully enters lunar orbit, gears up for precision moon landing
summary: Japan’s SLIM spacecraft entered lunar orbit Dec. 25, setting up a moon landing attempt scheduled for Jan. 19.

title: Firefly Alpha Flight 004 Ends in Anomaly
summary: After several delays due to uncooperative weather, Firefly’s Alpha launch vehicle has flown for the fourth time as part of the Fly the Lightning mission. Firefly was able to find a break in the weather on Friday morning, and the vehicle lifted off from SLC-2W at Vandenberg Space Force Base at 9:32 AM PST on December 22, 2023. The launch vehicle successfully lifted off on a mission to place the Tantrum satellite developed by Terran Orbital and Lockheed Martin into a unique retrograde orbit, flying the company’s first dedicated commercial mission. However, after the first planned second stage burn, the Lightning 1 upper stage engine did not reignite, resulting in a lower than intended orbit.

title: Rocket Lab wins $515 million contract to build 18 satellites for U.S. government agency
summary: Space launch provider and satellite manufacturer Rocket Lab has secured a deal worth over half a billion dollars to build 18 satellites for a U.S. government agency.

title: Space Rider Completes Initial Ground Segment Testing
summary:
Teams from Telespazio, ALTEC, and Thales Alenia Space have successfully completed the first ground segment tests for the European Space Agency’s reusable Space Rider spacecraft. Space Rider is an evolution of the IXV mission, which was launched on a suborbital test flight in February 2015. The vehicle is designed to carry payloads of up to […]
